input_text:
Job Title: In-House Paralegal

Location: Las Vegas, NV

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Legal

Description:
Home365 is a Technology Company based headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area with major offices in Las Vegas and Lancaster, PA with employees across 12 states and 3 countries. Post Series B Round of funding, Home365 is backed by the most respected Venture Capitalist and Corporate Venture Capitalist firms. Through cutting edge tech Home365 transforms how people experience investing in Real Estate - making it profitable, predictable, and passive.

We are seeking a skilled and dedicated in-house paralegal to join our legal team. As an in-house paralegal, you will have the opportunity to work closely with our legal department, providing vital support in various legal matters.Position Overview:

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented in-house paralegal to assist our legal team in managing a wide range of legal tasks. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills, exceptional attention to detail, and a solid understanding of legal procedures and documentation. This role will involve supporting attorneys in drafting legal documents, conducting legal research, maintaining and organizing legal files, and assisting with other administrative tasks as needed.
Responsibilities:Assist attorneys with drafting, reviewing, and editing legal documents, including contracts, agreements, and pleadings.Conduct legal research on various topics, including case law, statutes, and regulations.Organize and maintain legal files and documents, ensuring they are easily accessible and up-to-date.Coordinate with internal departments to gather necessary information and documentation for legal matters.Assist in preparing for meetings, hearings, and trials by compiling relevant materials and documents.Communicate professionally with clients, attorneys, and external parties as needed.Assist with administrative tasks, such as scheduling appointments, managing calendars, and handling correspondence.Stay up-to-date on legal developments and changes in relevant laws and regulations.
Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in paralegal studies, legal studies, or related fieldParalegal certificate from an ABA-approved program preferredA strong understanding of real estate and rental regulations5 years of experience working as a paralegal in a law firm or in-house legal departmentStrong proficiency in legal research tools and databasesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work independently and prioritize tasks effectivelyStrong organizational skills and attention to detailAbility to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion
Benefits:Competitive salary commensurate with experienceComprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision coverageRetirement savings plan with employer matchingPaid time off and holidaysProfessional development opportunities
Home365 is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: In-House Paralegal
output_json.summary: Seeking a skilled and dedicated in-house paralegal to join the legal team.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor's degree in paralegal studies, legal studies, or related field
required_skills: Solid understanding of legal procedures and documentation
job_responsibilities: Assist attorneys with drafting, reviewing, and editing legal documents
Prepare for meetings, hearings, and trials
Communicate with clients, attorneys, and external parties
benefits: Retirement savings plan with employer matching
output_json.company_information: Home365 is a Technology Company based in the San Francisco Bay Area with major offices in Las Vegas and Lancaster, PA. It has employees across 12 states and 3 countries. Backed by reputable Venture Capitalist and Corporate Venture Capitalist firms, Home365 uses cutting-edge technology to transform real estate investing.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Home365 is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
